inn1.comm: nice looking punch wide of mid-off to start off. Amir on a good length outside off, no swing back in despite the seam pointed inwards. Nizakat goes on the up and from under extra cover's dive
comes back in but he clips this off the toe. Inswinger on leg stump and he seems to be late on this , but it's pinged off the bat
outside edge falls short of second slip. Pushes from inside the line as this length ball skids through with the angle. To his credit, he's played that with soft hands
nudged fine. A poor ball from Amir, length and on the pads. He stays tall and uses his wrists to get this away
length on off stump, blocked to point from the crease
length on off stump, leans in and stabs this to cover's left with soft hands
length ball on the pads, stands tall once again and whips this down to fine leg
length ball on a sixth stump line, no swing. Left alone
beaten. Hangs the bat out and survives narrowly. It's a length ball coming in from quite wide outside off
short of a length and rising into the corridor from the pitch. Left alone
beaten again. Once more, it's angled in and he's pushing inside the line. No straightening off the pitch or anything. But a touch away from the body with the feet pinned in the crease
length and in at off stump, nicely behind the line this time to defend down the pitch
length on the pads, tapped into the leg side from deep in the crease
length on leg stump, pushed wide of mid-on on the up
143kph, short of a length on off stump, defended solidly off the back foot
length ball slanted in at off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
length on leg stump, pushed to mid-on and a confident call to steal his first run from that fielder
length on off stump, pushed to extra cover off the front foot
134kph, short of a length and in the corridor. Sliced on the bounce to backward point
short of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side off the back foot
127kph, short of a length on off, giving him nothing here. He can only offer a straight bat and keep this out
big appeal for lbw. Rath is beaten for pace and pinned in the crease. This comes in sharply and raps him on the front pad, but it's going down leg and the umpire turns it down
classy. Length on off, the first real driving delivery he's been given today. Leans in and opens the face to caress this between cover and point
short of a length outside off, opens the face to run this down, but there's an extra fielder backward of point and he can't beat him
short of a length outside off and hurrying him as he gets behind to try and punch through cover. It skews harmlessly into the point region
142kph, full and just outside off. Looks to pummel this drive through the off side but his bottom hand has come the bat

run-out appeal and Nizakat doesn't look confident here. At the striker's end. It was his call. And he's out! He's looking to avoid the throw in case it misses the stumps, and as a result, he has neither grounded the bat nor put in a dive. Evasive action, bat hanging in the air, so are his feet. Point's throw knocks the stumps down and after a good start, Nizakat has found a way to go. The run was on, and he really should have made it. Rath had dropped a length ball into the off side with soft hands. The calling was good too. Poor from Nizakat.
full on off stump, stabs with hard hands with no feet movement. Thick outside edge to point
length on off stump, defended down the pitch
length on off stump, defended from deep in the crease
short of a length and in at off stump, from wide of the crease. Pushed down the pitch off the outside half
138kph, short of a length on off stump. Tapped into the covers off the back foot

guides it to third man and for some reason, the second slip isn't there. He's had Rath quiet all innings so far, so it's strange that fielder isn't there. Short of a length outside off and he opens the face to get it through there
137kph, short and up at the ribs. Late on the hook, but manages to drag it safely to deep square
132kph, length on off stump and slanting away. Defended into the covers
length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
length and in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
overpitched and just outside off. Doesn't get this foot close to the ball as he drives to mid-off
offcutter at a length on off stump. Flicks it behind square off the front foot
short ball. Too short to surprise him. He sways away from it to let it pass
another short one. This is slightly down leg side and he allows it to go again
short of a length on middle stump, pushed to mid-on from the crease
length and in at off stump, defended solidly off the back foot
full on leg stump, pushed to mid-on. Was looking to flick that but it was onto him quicker than he could flick the wrists
beaten as he chucks the bat at a short ball outside off. It's that natural incoming angle that lulls him, but this short ball is quite wide outside off. His hook is of no effect.
toe-end as he opens his stance and looks to hammer one on the up. It trickles through to mid-on after getting the inside part of his bat
slapped on the up to the backward point boundary. Short and wide outside off, stays on the front foot and gets it wide of point and third man
length ball  into the pads, whips it on the up to deep square
aerial but just wide of point. Short and wide ball slanted across him and once again he scythes from under it on the front foot. Blazes past the fielder
length on off stump, defended down the pitch
bludgeons the short ball but Shadab gets in the way at point. Short and wide again from Faheem
length on middle stump, poked down the pitch from the crease

got him! Rath's early penchant for hanging the bat inside the line has returned and cost him his wicket. Slightly short of a length from Faheem, pushed across the corridor. Rath has barely moved across from his leg stump guard as he looks to run this down to third man. A thin edge, carries nicely to the keeper
short of a length outside off, left alone
length and in at middle stump. Defended down the pitch
length ball into the pads. Tapped to short midwicket on the up

struck on the right glove as he takes his eyes off this one. Completely cramped as this doesn't rise as high as he thinks it will. Expects that to sail over his left shoulder, but it's come in at his mid-riff
length ball in at leg stump. Stays very deep in the crease and defends this off the back foot
short of a length outside off, short-arm tap to midwicket
short and in at middle stump. Defended hurriedly off the back foot
135kph, short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, shuffles to get behind this and clips it to midwicket
short of a length and in at middle stump. Flicked to mid-on from the crease
short of a length on off, poked to midwicket with the angle
short of a length ball wide outside off, slashes on the up and gets a thick outside edge down to third man
short of a length outside off, nudged to sweeper cover on the up
short of a length outside off, mistimed chop to sweeper cover
short of a length on off stump, defended to point with soft hands
short of a length outside off, opens the face and guides it to third man
beaten. Short ball wide outside off, zips away off the surface. Looks to blitz this over midwicket but it's too far away

inside edge past the stumps. Rolls to fine leg's right. Hasn't looked comfortable at all today. This is a length ball outside off, he shows both middle and off stump as he tries to drill this through cover
length on off stump, defended to point from deep in the crease
overpitched on off stump, half a stride into this as he drives to short extra cover
short of a length on middle stump, clipped to deep square leg off the back foot
short ball at off stump. Can't get the glance away. It trickles down to mid-on
short ball outside off, arches into the leg side and lets it go
length and in at off stump, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, whipped across the line to mid-on
134kph, short of a length outside off, sliced to sweeper off the back foot

chips it to extra cover. Walks down the pitch at a short of a length ball, looks to power it through the off side. It's feeble and it's straight to the fielder. The slide continues. The runs aren't coming. A desperate shot from Carter.
hangs back against a short of a length delivery and drops it by his feet
lunges forward outside off to defend into the covers
presents the full face of the bat as Hasan goes full and outside off. Good work from mid-off by the substitute Nawaz, running and diving to his left
excellent lines from the fast bowler, around the off stump, testing the new batsman. Shah defends
bouncer, which is par for the course against Hayat who has been slow to spot them. This time he's able to duck under it
pushes the back of a length ball to the left of cover
needs to bring his bat around the front pad as Ashraf goes full on leg stump, but manages to tickle it away to long leg
plops the shortish delivery outside off to point. He's remarkably reluctant to come forward on the crease
searches for a push-and-run into the covers, but this ball holds in the pitch a little longer and makes contact with the inside half of the bat and lands on the pitch itself
defends a good length ball while on the move as he comes forward
short ball, flies past his back shoulder as he ignores it. That's drinks
uses the angle with the bowler running in from round the wicket and gently works it round the corner to long leg
thinks about a single after pushing the short ball on middle down to mid-on, but the fielder there is too quick, Nawaz again.
rises with the short ball outside off and taps it to the right of Amir at third man
good length and outside off, Shah blocks towards point
nice and full on off stump, Shah drives to mid-off
slower ball to finish the over, Shah picks it and blocks with a smile

stumped by a mile. The perfect introduction for Shadab Khan in this Asia Cup. Dribbles out his googly. The batsman doesn't pick it. He's charging out of his crease to hammer the ball over the top. But when it spins in, he's desperately out of place. Goes through with his shot, gets beaten on the inside edge and Sarfraz does the rest. Simple. Too simple.
beats him with the leggie this time, tossing it up nicely to draw the batsman forward and then getting it ti dip and turn the outside edge

traps him lbw! And it's the googly again. He's ridiculously accurate with that ball, pitching it on a length just outside off. Ehsan thinks it's a legbreak again and goes back to deal with it, but when it breaks in, he's panicking. He ends up flicking across the line, deep in his crease, and is struck in line with middle stump
more googlies as Aizaz lunges forward to block
quicker delivery outside off - it almost goes straight through with the arm as the batsman leaves. Double-wicket maiden
guides the back of a length delivery outside off - from round the wicket - to deep third man
lbw appeal as Hasan pitches it up and gets a length ball to skid into the right-hander. Big inside edge from Aizaz though
opens the face and steers the shortish delivery to deep third man
leans over the front leg and flicks the full delivery on middle to long leg. Good thing he gets bat on it; otherwise he would have been lbw
full and outside off, he spears it through to the sweeper cover
full on off stump, drives to mid-off
another googly, pitching outside off, pushing the batsman back in his crease, preparing him to be lbw. This time there's some bat involved as he flicks
the orthodox legbreak now as Aizaz goes on the drive and is comfortably beaten outside off
another loopy legbreak from Shadab, and this time Aizaz gets forward and, rather riskily, strikes it past the right of the man at cover for a boundary.
premeditates a sweep, but misses the googly that pitches outside off and strikes him on the front pad

finishes the over with a googly, flatter and quicker. Aizaz goes back to pull but mistimes it. Although he does eventually make contact with the ball - the back of the bat sending it nearly into the hands of slip
starts with a low full toss from around the wicket, Shah drives to long-off
stays round the wicket for a flighted delivery on off stump. Defends
drifts it away outside the right-hander's off stump, Aizaz drives to cover
hangs back to a good length ball on middle and when it skids through, he has to hurry into his front foot defence

tries to scoop a good length ball wandering down leg. But he misses it. Sarfraz goes for an appeal, thinking there's a bit of bat involved. The umpire Shaun George says no and signals a wide. The Pakistan captain takes a long, long time, thinking about the review and decides against it. Replays however show there is a bit of glove
tosses it up on off stump, he defends
beats him outside off with the right-hander playing inside the line of a legbreak
backs away and cuts the shortish delivery outside off to deep cover
drives it neatly to the long-off boundary. A tough too full from Shadab and Kinchit gets to the pitch of the ball and times it perfectly
appeal for lbw as Kinchit goes back to try and flick a good length ball away.
nicely tossed up on off stump, the right-hander defends with his inside edge. Not sure he read the googly
knocks it down to long-off
nudges a tossed up delivery on leg stump through square leg
good length on off stump, defends off the front foot
shifts back to turn a flatter delivery on leg stump to midwicket
flicks a shorter delivery on leg stump through square leg
drives firmly to long-off
lovely drift for Shadab as he forces the left-hander to plant his front leg across his stumps and the turn tempts the lbw. Kinchit manages to get an inside edge
nurdles it towards midwicket
stands tall as he punches the shortish delivery - a googly - to cover
on the pads and Kinchit tickles it to leg gully
works it off his pads to long leg. A touch short there from Shadab
presses forward to defend a flighted delivery outside off with an open face
reads the flight on this delivery on off stump and defends quite smartly
a lot of chatter from Sarfraz after Amir gives away a single at short fine leg. "Never a single there," he says
and that little reprimand earlier in the over makes Amir work that bit harder, running up to the left-hander's flick and keeping him on strike
shortish on middle, flicks to midwicket
stands back, and tall, and punches through point
dances down the pitch and launches the ball over extra cover. High-quality shot from Aizaz, getting to the pitch of the ball and, seeing there's not much turn on the pitch, hitting through the line
good length on middle, Kinchit defends
slips down leg, past Kinchit's flick
googly from Shadab, which the left-hander tries to scoop. Doesn't connect. Is struck on the pads. Huge appeal from Shadab but umpire Shah says no
shortish and outside off, Kinchit cuts to point, who isn't prepared for the ball spinning away from him
short of a length, outside off, defends
another googly - flatter in trajectory and outside off - which is why the right-hander jumps back to cut and when the ball breaks the wrong way, he's nearly bowled
back to the legbreak - very slow and deliciously tossed up - Aizaz pushes forward to block, well away from his body, and is beaten
good length and outside off, defends
angling into the pads and Kinchit flicks it off the front foot to long leg
full on off stump, defends to point
slower short ball, which Aizaz picks, holds his shape and pulls very nicely to deep midwicket
shortish and outside off, chops to point
steers a back of a length deliverry into the covers
starts with a googly again, and it breaks into the right-hander just slow enough that he can put bat to it. Shadab smacks a fist into the other palm
loopy delivery well outside off, allows Aizaz to meet it on the full and slog sweep it to the boundary. The captain, from behind the stumps, pleads, "Shadab, bowl on one side of the wicket please"
good length and outside off, defends
defends with an open face to point
another appeal for lbw as Aizaz sweeps. Struck outside the line. Even though it is the googly, bringing the stumps into business
picks the googly and pulls it away to the right of long-on. Too short from Shadab and Sarfraz calls his bowler out on it
full on off stump, defends
uses the angle of the ball into him to pick up a single at midwicket
full and outside off, he drives through the covers
works it away off his pads to deep square leg
goes around the wicket now, getting the shortish delivery to straighten just enough that the right-hander is squared up. Block to point
goes wide of the crease and targets the base of the stumps. Aizaz keeps it out
works it neatly off middle and leg out to deep midwicket. Good effort from these two, especially to survive Shadab Khan
fifty-partnership. as Kinchit cuts to deep third man

gives it lbw, but Aizaz reviews! Looks to pull a ball that really isn't all that short. It skids through and strikes him on the back leg - in the thigh area - so it's possible it can go over the stumps. Ultra-Edge says no bat. HawkEye says missing. Umpire Shah has to overturn his decision
in an effort to go straight, he strays on the pads. Aizaz gets a freebie to put away to long leg. He can't
superb short, hanging back against the short ball, rolling his wrists on top of it and pulling it down to long leg
firm thud from the middle of the bat as Kinchit defends the short ball outside off
gets forward to meet the full delivery from outside off with a dead bat. Amir bowling round the stumps
top save from Sarfraz, leaping to his right. Aizaz gets a thick outside edge to a juicy full toss outside off. It's racing away to the third man boundary until the Pakistan captain intervenes
goes short now and Aizaz mistimes his pull so badly it doesn't even carry to midwicket
slower ball outside off, Aizaz defends to point
toe-ends a pull shot that wanders out to deep third man. Amir's changes of pace are working for him so far
good length, cramping him for room, Kinchit blocks
shifts back to defend a back of a length ball on middle
too quick for the right-hander as Aizaz goes for a pull against a short ball down leg

bowled im! A cracker of a ball too. Quick. Pitched-up. And almost insanely - it darts in off the pitch. There is sideways movement in the UAE! Usman puts everything he has into this, a bolt upright seam helping it to change direction after kissing the surface. Aizaz is slow to come forward. He leaves a big gap as he tries to defend and the ball hurtles through it. Exceptional bowling
gets in line with a shortish delivery outside off and knocks it down
he's stuck in his crease even against a pretty full delivery outside off. Speeds always on the rise from Usman and it's nearly enough to get through McKechnie too

plumb in front as Usman goes for the yorker. McKechnie shuffles all the way across his stumps and falls over while playing the flick. He misses. The ball thuds into his pads, perfectly in line with middle. Umpire Shah raises the finger but the two Hong Kong batsmen come up to discuss taking a review, but they take way too long to make the sign

off stump takes a beating. It's too quick. It's perfectly on target. And what can a tail-ender do against something so menacing. Afzal barely presents a shot to it, stuck in the crease, poking his bat out almost in apology. Another sensational indipper from round the wicket
lunges forward at a good length ball outside off and blocks
opens the face and slices a short ball outside off to deep third man
outside edge as Nawaz stays inside the line of a back of a length delivery and pushes at it with hard hands
on the pads, tucks it to long leg
drives off the bottom of the bat to mid-off
nearly gets the hat-trick! It's full, from round the wicket, it's in line with middle and leg stump. And it's at the tail-ender too. But Nawaz is able to put bat to ball
excellent stop at point by Shadab, keeps the No. 10 on strike, by moving swiftly to his left and diving to keep the ball from beating him. Little glide to little avail
back of a length and outside off, cuts to gully
good length outside off, he comes forward to defend and gets an inside edge onto pad
full on middle, he blocks down the pitch

finds backward point and that is the last specialist batsman gone. Kinchit's vigil ends tamely. It's a length ball utside off, he looks to slice it on the rise but it ends up stopping on him and he can only lob it for Shadab. A good knock that less than three overs ago seemed to have rescued his team. But the slide seems unstoppable now
inswinging length ball in the corridor, punched to mid-off on the up
shot! Let's assume he meant to do this. Another inswinger, at a good length and in at middle stump. Nadeem stands tall, hardly any feet, full face offered and punched over mid-on
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
slower ball full on middle stump, clipped towards mid-on off the front foot
beaten. A quick skiddy delivery at a good length outside off. He stays leg side of it and stabs at it. Too late.
length ball wide outside off, rips past the outside edge
tossed up at off stump, tapped through cover off the front foot
swatted away. A flat googly delivered on a good length. Ehsan plants the front leg across and crashes it to the square leg boundary
floated up on off stump, driven back at the bowler
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover with the turn
full outside off, high backlift as he drives to sweeper cover
full ball outside off, opens the face and drives out to sweeper cover
full inswinger at off stump, defended solidly back at the bowler
length on leg stump, backs away into the leg side and hurriedly pokes this into the off
short ball on middle stump, ducks under it and allows it to go
length ball on off stump, defended into the off side
short of a length on off stump, tapped to cover who gets a direct hit in at the striker's end - only to give them an overthrow at long leg
tossed up outside off, driven with the turn to sweeper cover
googly, short of a length outside off, left alone and it climbs past his back pad
tossed up outside off, thick outside edge to sweeper's left as he looks to drive on the up
struck on the back leg. Looks to play the forward defence, beaten by the googly
short of a length on leg stump, backs away to cut but gets an inside edge towards fine leg
short and wide outside off, zips past the attempted cut

there's a good chance Pakistan might have missed two run-out opportunities off the same ball...nope, they've got the wicket. A length ball on leg stump, tapped to mid-on. Both batsmen down the pitch, not sure which one said no, but they were both running back. Mid-on missed the chance at the non-striker's end, but the bowler, who was backing up, gathered the ball and chucked it gently towards' Sarfraz who had plenty of time by the end of this strange sequence

inn2.comm: full outswinger, dipping away outside off. Draws him into the drive and he gets a thick edge down to third man
full on off stump, poked down the pitch off the front foot
length ball bowled very wide outside off and left alone
full on off stump, driven to mid-off's right with soft hands
length on off stump, defended to mid-on off the front foot
length on off stump, punched into the off side off the front foot
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
short of a length and in at off stump. Under-edged into the pitch as he looks to punch
length ball in at the thighs. Can't get the flick away, it pings into the off side. But the bowler had over-stepped. It'll be a free hit
short ball outside off, backs away and looks to go through the leg side with a pull. But that skids on and he ends up slicing it wide of mid-off
length outside off, pushed into the off side off the front foot
short ball in the corridor, mistimed punch into the covers
length on leg stump, allows it to come on and caresses the flick to fine leg's right
short of a length and in at leg stump. Watches it come on as he whips it on the up in front of square leg

big shout for lbw as he's pinned on the back foot trying to flick one. But that has pitched outside leg and he might have got an inside edge too as he looked to punch off the back foot through the leg side
length on off stump, punched off the back foot to mid-off
length outside off, chopped to point off the under-edge
short and just outside off, chops into the turf in front of point
full and floated up at off stump, driven towards mid-off off the inside half
short of a length outside off, gets down for the square drive but he can't get it past point
short ball at off stump, dragged to deep square's right with a mistimed pull
length outside off, sliced on the up to third man
punched through the covers. It's an offcutter at a length with plenty of room. He doesn't make great connection on this, but it's placed exactly where he wants it and it dribbles away
length on the pads, parried with the angle, but short fine dives to his right to get a hand on this
short of a length and in at the stumps. Gets on the back foot and whips to fine leg's right
short of a length on off stump, nudged to midwicket off the thick inside edge
short of a length in the corridor, tapped into the covers
length on leg stump, flicked on the up to short midwicket
length outside off, sliced on the up to cover point
length on off stump, punched back to the bowler on the bounce
short of a length in the corridor. Gets the attempted pull to midwicket off the inside half of the bat
full on off stump, punched firmly back down the pitch. Bowler parries it to mid-off with his right hand
overpitched on leg stump, stands tall and clips this through midwicket with a big follow through. Nice balance
length outside off, chopped on the up to third man's left
short of a length on off stump, closes the face to tap this into the leg side
full on middle stump, flicked to mid-on
length on off stump, mistimed drive on the up to short extra
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket with a closed face
length on off stump, tapped to mid-off on the up
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket

carts him over midwicket with an old-fashioned hoick. Length ball slanted across him, he gets his back knee onto the floor, the front leg out of the way and swings a monstrous swing through the line to clear the boundary, flat.
length on leg stump, punched to mid-on on the up
bowler gets a hand on it but he's hit that so hard, it'll still go to the boundary. Keeper is up, but Zaman skips down the track, meets the length ball at the pitch and drills it back down the pitch
length on middle stump, punches this one back down the pitch, but it strikes the stumps at the other end
back of a length and outside off, pushes to cover
hangs back to pull a short ball on off stump, but it's mistimed to square leg
brings the bat around his pad, with just enough time to flick the length ball away to avoid lbw and also pick up runs through midwicket
closes the bat face to turn a short ball outside off to midwicket
taps and runs to mid-off, spotting the man hugging the 30-yard circle.
charges down the track to wallop a length ball outside off past the right of mid-off.

celebrappeal from Ehsan Khan and umpire Shah yields to it. Zaman has to go, caught behind, and it's a pretty epic grab too. McKechnie ends up having to juggle it a bit - the ball bouncing off his leg and up into his hands - but he does stay in control of the ball, which can't be said about Zaman, who cuts a ball that isn't quite wide enough and gets a bottom edge
good length on middle, nudges it to square leg
stands tall and drills the ball down the ground. Having placed it wide enough to the right of mid-on, they pinch a second
gorgeous drive past the left of cover. Babar leaning into his drives, looking swoon-worthy
shifts his weight back and taps a shortish delivery to midwicket
back of a length on middle, Iman turns it to midwicket
steps out of his crease again and drives smoothly to mid-off
works it off his pads behind square leg
full on off stump, defends
shapes for a big shot, but there isn't enough room to free the arms and so he ends up defending to cover
drills a straight drive back at the stumps at the non-strikers', and it may even have taken a little finger from the bowler on the way. Luckily, Imam has his bat grounded behind the crease
goes back against the shortish delivery on off stump and pushes to cover
opens the face as he tries to exploit the width on this offbreak. Can't beat point
lunges forward to drive the tossed up delivery back down the pitch
shapes to cut again, but the ball zips through, over the top edge
full on off stump, blocks
shortish and outside off, cuts behind point
full and outside off, carves it to the sweeper
the ball drifts away from the left-hander, securing his outside edge as he comes forward to block
good length, outside off, zips through past the edge as Imam attempts to cut
good length, on off stump, defends
rocks back to cut a flatter delivery outside off towards the third man boundary. Good effort from Kinchit, keeping it to three
nudges to midwicket
plenty of space square on the off side for Imam to exploit. And Ehsan helps him out by bowling short on a slow pitch
quicker, flatter, and well down leg. Babar flicks to long leg
shimmies down the pitch to defend this one that Ehsan pushes through on middle

lbw appeal, but umpire Shah ignores it. So Anshy Rath reviews. And this does appear to be plumb. Ehsan's flatter delivery again - except this is full - and Iman makes the mistake of playing the trajectory, going deep in his crease and ending up being pinned in front of middle. There's a spike on UltraEdge but it seems to happen after the ball passes the bat, but the third umpire takes that as confirmation of there being an inside edge. and rules it not out This is very very odd
goes back and punches to cover
defends a quicker delivery on middle
rocks back to push the flatter delivery into the covers
takes leave of his crease to launch a good length ball over long-on. Goes all the way, reward for splendid footwork, which took him right to the pitch of the ball.
full on off stump, Babar blocks into the leg side, searching for a single. Not there
whirl of the wrists as he tries to smuggle a ball on middle through the leg side. Can't pull it off
stays legside of this quicker delivery on middle and leg and drills it through cover
shuffles across as the left-arm spinner stays over the wicket. Imam flicks to square leg
shapes to turn the full delivery on leg stump through midwicket, but the ball turns just enough to pop a leading edge through cover
pushes it through on leg stump, Babar sends it to square leg
beats him with the drift into the left-hander from round the wicket and Imam, after coming down the track, is lucky to have the pad in the way to save himself from being stumped or bowled
short and outside off, cuts to the sweeper
too short again and Babar clatters it to the point boundary. Outstanding footwork, pushing deep in his crease to give him the time and the room he needs to cut this bad ball to oblivion

huge lbw appeal again and this time umpire George says no. Nadeem is bowling over the wicket at the left-hander, so there's a chance this might have pitched outside leg. But it didn't seem like it on first glance. Yep HawkEye reveals three reds. Second life for Imam
works it to long-on
tosses it up on middle, defends
flicks it through to deep square leg, meeting it gently enough to pinch two before deep square leg can catch up with it
good length on off stump, defends
comes down the pitch to defend on off stump
steps out to drive to the left of cover. Rath misfields to offer up a run
jumps back in his crease the moment the length is short and works it to deep square leg
full on off stump, Imam defends, looking for a single at long-off. But Ehsan moves across and puts in a dive to prevent that
rocks back to cut the short ball outside off to the sweeper
punches a short ball on middle to long-on
short and outside off, he cuts to backward point
drums it down to the long-on boundary. Babar's on autopilot right now, gliding down the pitch against the spinners and doing whatever he pleases thereafter
that's 2000 runs in ODIs and he gets it in his 45th innings - making him joint-second-fastest in the world. The shot - if you're curious - is a backfoot punch through the covers
another lovely cut shot, using the depth of the crease and playing the ball ever so late that it didn't even matter there wasn't too much room
full on middle, taps it to midwicket
gets the gap behind point and he does so only by waiting for the ball a second or two longer. Sure there's width. And it's short. But that shot is just class
full on middle, defends
down the pitch for a block
steps out and unveils an inside-out cover drive to the man in the deep
reads the length as short, rocks back in his crease and ever so easily punches to long-on
full and outside off, defends
a little bit of turn even as Imam comes down the pitch to send it to cover
flicks through to deep midwicket
gets in line with a short ball on off stump
a lovely little late cut as he allows the back of a length ball to come to him outside off
shortish on off stump, keeps it out with soft hands
nudges a good length ball to short midwicket
gorgeous drive to mid-off. And he spends a couple of seconds annoyed at himself for not picking the gap
drops and runs behind point. Good work, soft hands
goes back to defend to short midwicket
caught behind as he makes room to cut a ball spinning into off stump. Skids through under his bat, picking up a bottom edge and into the keeper's gloves. Another lovely take from McKechnie
good length ball zips into the right-hander, spinning past the inside edge as he attempts a flick shot
backs away to cut a shortish delivery on off stump. No run to point
stands tall and crunches a length ball to long-on
goes back to block through point, and since there's only vacant spaces there...
comes down the pitch but Nawaz adjusts to it, going for a bouncer. Too high says the umpire

wallops it over long-on! For half a second, it seems like he's been done in by the bowler responding to his charge out of the crease. But Imam meets the short ball head on and pulls it away ever so strongly
full and outside off, drives to mid-off
back of a length on leg stump, works it behind square leg
bouncer, he ignores it
defends the back of a length ball to short midwicket
flicks it off his pads to deep square leg
flicks the full delivery on leg stump to deep midwicket
nudges the ball straying on leg to long leg
slips down leg
appeal for lbw, but Malik gets an inside edge as he goes for a flick
this time the flick works, the length ball on middle scurrying away in front of square leg
full on off stump, defends
one-bounce into the long-on ropes. Imam is on 49, getting there with an eager couple of steps down the pitch and a launch over the bowler's head
opens the face to plop a ball on off stump into the sprawling real estate at third man
blocks to point, looking for the run that gets him a fifty. Not there
clips it off his hips through to deep square leg. Brings up fifty, his first, in addition to his four previous hundreds in ODIs
launches a short ball to the midwicket boundary and seals a comprehensive win for Pakistan
